discussion.title: On how to load some prior knowledge of known formulas
discussion.body:
Hi, Miles!

I'm recently testing your excellent tool on explainable AI, so I wish I could somehow merge the PySR workflow better with neural networks.
On the official website of PySR, I only saw that you can load 'pretrained models' from a pickle file. 
But is it feasible to directly load a prior formula with sympy?
Say, you've known the classic momentum formula: p = m * v, can you input this prior knowledge, and let PySR to regress out the one in special relativity?

Much appreciated!

nodes.body:
Hi @NoRatRacing,

Great question. Unfortunately there isn’t anything built in at the moment. It shouldn’t be too bad to add it. If you have some time available I could walk you through adding it. I can try myself but have a list of other features I’m working on so it will take a bit longer before I can work on it.

Note that you can restart from where the previous search left off when you use the `warm_start` parameter and call `fit` twice. So I think this feature could exploit that same functionality, and basically pass the prior knowledge as existing equations/population members.

What do you think?

Cheers,
Miles
